A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
What plot there is dissipates as the movie meanders along somewhere between a bad episode of battlestar galactica and wacky races. I am not a die hard star wars fan and I'm not bothered apart the folklore particularly but this is a horrendous miss fire as a movie on any level.

Characters appear almost at random and then disappear just as quickly. Then reappear. And fight. Or flee. Or both. New characters pop up with no warning do really important stuff to try to get the film out of the narrative brick wall it drove itself in to. Or a parking violation does the same thing. If there is a reference to the usual suspects buried in there\, it matches the lameness of the film.

I am trying to remember the script but it went 'something something jedi' pause\, cut to planet\, failed joke\, something something jedi. Fight'. Almost left but gave it an extra half a star for the last twenty minutes being action packed.
